snippet: The Met’s “Faking It: Manipulated Photography Before Photoshop” shows how photographers have been cheating since shortly after the medium’s invention almost two centuries ago.
abstract: Ken Johnson reviews Metropolitan Museum of Art exhibit Faking: Manipulated Photography Before Photoshop, which shows how photographers have been cheating since shortly after the medium's invention almost two centuries ago.
lead_paragraph: The Met’s “Faking It: Manipulated Photography Before Photoshop” shows how photographers have been cheating since shortly after the medium’s invention almost two centuries ago.

headline.seo: ‘Faking It’ at the Met, a Photography Exhibition
headline.main: Their Cheating Art: Reality and Illusion
headline.print_headline: Their Cheating Art: Reality and Illusion
